intro: Seseli sessiliflorum, commonly known as the sessile-flower seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a pungent, aromatic scent. Native to the Mediterranean region, it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. This plant is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas.
